\begin{document}

\title{A Concise Representation Shunn's Two-Dimensional Variable-Density MMS Solutions}


\author{Tony Saad}

\maketitle

For all the solutions presented in this document, we use a simple mixing model for two streams given by
\begin{equation}
\frac{1}{\rho} =\frac{1-f}{{\rho_0}}+\frac{f}{{\rho_1}}
\end{equation}
where the mixture fraction $f$ is transported via
\begin{equation}
\frac{\partial \rho f}{\partial t} + \nabla\cdot\mathbf{u}\rho f = \nabla \rho \Gamma \cdot \nabla f + R_f
\end{equation}

This document simplifies the presentation and implementation of two 
important variable density analytical solutions using the MMS approach.
Both can be found in \cite{shunn_moin2012}.

\section{Corrugated-Front MMS}
For this problem, we set
\begin{equation}
\hat{x} = u_f t - x + a \cos[k (v_f t - y)];
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}
f = \frac{1 + \tanh(b \hat{x} e^{-w t})}{1 + \tfrac{\rho0}{\rho1} + (1 + \tfrac{\rho0}{\rho1})\tanh(b \hat{x} e^{-w t})}
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}
u = \frac{\rho_1 - \rho_0}{\rho}\left\{-\omega \hat{x} + \frac{ \omega \hat{x} - u_f}{\exp\left[2 b \hat{x} \exp(-\omega t)\right] + 1 } + \frac{\omega \ln\left[\exp(2b\hat{x} \exp(-\omega t) + 1)\right]}{2 b \exp(-\omega t)}\right\}
%u := (r1 - r0)/\rho*(-w xh + (w xh - uf)/(
%     Exp[2 b xh Exp[-w t]] + 1) + (w Log[Exp[2 b xh Exp[-w t]] + 1])/(
%     2 b Exp[-w t]));
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}
v = v_f
\end{equation}
The continuity equation does not require a source term. The mixture fraction equation requires the addition of a source term. Let
\begin{align*}
s_0 & = e^{t w}; \\
s_1 & = u_f t - x + a \cos[k (v_f t - y)]; \\
s_2 & = e^{2 b s_1/s_0}
%s2 := E^((2 b s1)/s0);
\end{align*}

\begin{align*}
R_f = & \frac{r_0 r_1 s_2}{s_0^2 (r_0 + r_1 s_2)^3} \times \\
      & \left \{-4 A b^2 r_0 - 2 a^2 A b^2 k^2 r_0 + 4 A b^2 r_1 s_2 + 
 2 a^2 A b^2 k^2 r_1 s_2 + 2 b r_0 r_1 s_0 u_f \right. \\
      & + 2 b r_1^2 s_0 s_2 u_f -2 b r_0^2 s_0 t u_f w - 2 b r_0 r_1 s_0 s_2 t u_f w + 2 b r_0^2 s_0 w x \\
      &+ 2 b r_0 r_1 s_0 s_2 w x +2 a b s_0 (r_0 + r_1 s_2) (A k^2 - r_0 w) \cos[k (t v_f - y)] \\
      &+ 
 2 a^2 A b^2 k^2 (r_0 - r_1 s_2) \cos[2 k (t v_f - y)] +r_0^2 s_0^2 w \ln[1 + s_2] \\
 & - r_0 r_1 s_0^2 w \ln(1 + s_2) +r_0 r_1 s_0^2 s_2 w \ln(1 + s_2) \\
 & \left . - r_1^2 s_0^2 s_2 w \ln(1 + s_2)\right\}
\end{align*}

\section{Oscillating MMS}
For this periodic problem, we set
\begin{align*}
\hat{x} = & x - u_f t \\
\hat{y} = & y - \varv_f t \\
\bar{x} = & \pi k \hat{x} \\
\bar{y} = & \pi k \hat{y} \\
\bar{t} = & \pi \omega t
\end{align*}

\begin{equation}
	f = \frac{\sin (\bar{x} ) \sin (\bar{y}) \cos (\bar{t}) + 1}
	         {\left(1-\frac{\rho_0}{\rho_1}\right) \sin (\bar{x}) \sin (\bar{y}) \cos (\bar{t})+\left(1 + \frac{{\rho_0}}{{\rho_1}}\right)};
\end{equation}



\begin{equation}
\rho u=\left(\frac{-\omega}{4 k}\right)({\rho_1}-{\rho_0}) \cos (\bar{x}) \sin (\bar{y}) \sin (\bar{t})
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
\rho \varv= \left(\frac{-\omega}{4 k}\right)({\rho_1}-{\rho_0}) \sin (\bar{x}) \cos (\bar{y}) \sin (\bar{t})
\end{equation}
The source term for the continuity equation is
\begin{equation}
R_\rho=\frac{1}{2} \pi  k ({\rho_0}-{\rho_1}) \cos (\bar{t}) \left[ {u_f} \cos (\bar{x}) \sin (\bar{y})+{\varv_f} \sin (\bar{x}) \cos (\bar{y})\right]
\end{equation}
so that
\begin{equation}
\frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} + \nabla\cdot\rho\mathbf{u} = R_\rho
\end{equation}
The source term for the mixture fraction is given by $R_f$ such that

\begin{align*}
&s_0  = \cos(\pi \omega t),\\
&s_1  = \sin(\pi \omega t),\\ 
&s_2  = \cos(k \pi x),\\ 
&s_3  = \sin(k \pi x),\\ 
&s_4  = \cos(k \pi y),\\
&s_5  = \sin(k \pi y), \\
&s_6  = \sin[k \pi (x -t u_f)], \\
&s_7  = \sin[k \pi (y -t \varv_f)], \\
&s_8 = \cos[k \pi (x -t u_f)], \\
&s_9 = \cos[k \pi (y -t \varv_f)], \\
&s_{10} = \rho_0 + \rho_1, \\
&s_{11} = \rho_0 - \rho_1 \\
& A \equiv \rho \Gamma = \text{constant}
\end{align*}

\begin{align*}
R_f  = & -\frac{\pi  \rho_1}{4 (s_{10} - s_0 s_6 s_7 s_{11} )^3}\times \\
       &\left\{
       16 A k^2 \pi \rho_0 s_0^2 s_9^2 s_{11} s_6^2 \right. \\
& - 16 A k^2 \pi \rho_0 s_0 s_{10} s_6 s_7 
  + 16 A k^2 \pi \rho_0 s_0^2 s_8^2 s_{11} s_7^2 \\
& + 16 A k^2 \pi \rho_0 s_0^2 s_{11} s_6^2 s_7^2
  + 2 k s_0 s_8 s_{10}^3 s_7 u_f \\
& - 6 k \rho_0^2 s_0^2 s_8 s_{11} s_6 s_7^2 u_f 
  - 12 k \rho_0 \rho_1 s_0^2 s_8 s_{11} s_6 s_7^2 u_f \\
& - 6 k \rho_1^2 s_0^2 s_8 s_{11} s_6 s_7^2 u_f 
  + 6 k s_0^3 s_8 s_{10} s_{11}^2 s_6^2 s_7^3 u_f \\
& - 2 k s_0^4 s_8 s_{11}^3 s_6^3 s_7^4 u_f 
  + 2 k s_0 s_9 s_{10}^3 s_6 \varv_f \\
& - 6 k \rho_0^2 s_0^2 s_9 s_{11} s_6^2 s_7 \varv_f 
  - 12 k \rho_0 \rho_1 s_0^2 s_9 s_{11} s_6^2 s_7 \varv_f \\
& - 6 k \rho_1^2 s_0^2 s_9 s_{11} s_6^2 s_7 \varv_f 
  + 6 k s_0^3 s_9 s_{10} s_{11}^2 s_6^3 s_7^2 \varv_f \\
& - 2 k s_0^4 s_9 s_{11}^3 s_6^4 s_7^3 \varv_f
  - 2 \rho_0 s_0 s_1 s_9^2 s_{10} s_{11} s_6^2 w \\
& + 4 \rho_0 s_1 s_{10}^2 s_6 s_7 w
  + 2 \rho_0 s_0^2 s_1 s_9^2 s_{11}^2 s_6^3 s_7 w \\
& - 5 \rho_0 s_0 s_1 s_{10} s_{11} s_7^2 w
  + 3 \rho_0 s_0 s_1 s_8^2 s_{10} s_{11} s_7^2 w \\
& - 3 \rho_0 s_0 s_1 s_{10} s_{11} s_6^2 s_7^2 w
  + 2 \rho_0 s_0^2 s_1 s_8^2 s_{11}^2 s_6 s_7^3 w \\
& + 4 \rho_0^2 s_0^2 s_1 s_{11} s_6^3 s_7^3 w 
 \left. - 4 \rho_0 \rho_1 s_0^2 s_1 s_{11} s_6^3 s_7^3 w \right\}
%       &  \left \{ k (\rho_0-\rho_1) \cos ^2(\bar{t}) \left(-s_0 -s_1 + s_2 + s_3 + s_4 - s_5 - s_6\right) \right.\\
%	  & + k (\rho_0+\rho_1) \cos (\bar{t}) \left( s_7 + s_8 \right) \\
%	  & + k (\rho_0-\rho_1)^2 \sin ^2(\bar{x}) \sin ^2(\bar{y}) \cos ^3(\bar{t}) (u_f \cos (\bar{x}) \sin (\bar{y})+\varv_f \sin (\bar{x}) \cos (\bar{y})) \\
%	  &\left. +\frac{1}{2} \rho_0 w  \left[s_7      +\sin (\bar{y})  \left(s_8 + s_{11}\right) \right] \right\}
\end{align*}
